Title: Archaeology of consumption in Ottoman urban centres: the case study of Iznik ware from the Belgrade Fortress in the 16th and 17th centuries Une archéologie de la consommation dans les centres urbains ottomans : une étude de cas des céramiques Iznik des XVIe et XVIIe siècles de la Forteresse de Belgrade Eine Verbraucher-Archäologie in städtischen Ottoman-Zentren: eine Fall-Beschreibung der 16. Und 17. Jh. Iznik-Ware aus dem Fort in Belgrad Archeologia del consumo nei centri urbani Ottomani: la ceramica di Iznik dal castello di Belgrado fra XVI e XVII secolo come caso di studio Una arqueología del consumo en los centros urbanos otomanos: la cerámica Iznik de los siglos XVI y XVII en la fortaleza de Belgrado
Abstract: © 2017, © Society for Post-Medieval Archaeology 2017.SUMMARY: This article advocates a holistic approach to consumption studies in the urban centres of the Middle Danube region during the Ottoman period (16th–17th centuries) using the example of Iznik ware from the Belgrade Fortress. Combined results of archaeological and scientific research provide insight into regional consumption patterns, which is important for the understanding of cultural variability across the Ottoman Empire. This work emphasizes the importance of contextualized studies of archaeological ceramics in the development of post-medieval archaeology.
